website_summaries.verdict: Sticky bug traps ideal for potted houseplants, safe alternative to poisons/chemicals.
pros: Easy-to-use, simply put sticky stakes into soil of houseplants or potted outdoor plants for control of fruit flies, gnats, midges, and other pests
Bright yellow color plus attractive glue draw in and trap bugs
Effective and safe, a natural alternative to pesticides
cons: Doesn't affect bug propagation cycle, so depending on infestation, need to keep using

customer_reviews.title: -_- It's just a little irritating when merch is sold like this. It's like selling me a package deal ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should. But you get 7 yellow sticky strips and 7 sticks which can hold 2 stickies as shown in the picture.. -_- It's just a little irritating when merch is sold like this. It's like selling me a package deal of 8 flagpoles and 4 flags.. What do you want me to do with my 4 naked flagpoles?
customer_reviews.author: Pickles

customer_reviews.title: Tiny flies love this- then they die
customer_reviews.text: I ended up with a tiny fly invasion after reporting a few houseplants. Tried many different non toxic approaches and this worked like magic- brought the numbers of flies waaaaay down. We ultimately did an outdoor spray of the plants to eradicate them once and for all, but we keep these in the plants to prevent a comeback. These work great! We tried similarly colored yellow tape to try to save money and the fliers weren't interested, so there's something in this formulation (maybe the glue?) that works.
customer_reviews.author: globe trotter

customer_reviews.title: Good to mitigate fungus gnats
customer_reviews.text: If you have an issue with fungus gnats - it actually helps to mitigate it dramatically. I put couple of potted flowers indoors, and in a month fungus gnats started to appear pretty much everywhere around the house. I was looking for any kind of spray, but learned that it is inefficient against fungus gnats. So I installed these traps, and in two weeks yellow stickers were half-covered with gnats. I used couple of packs by now, and I don't see gnats around the house anymore. It did not eliminate them completely, I still can see a few of them next to the pots. But the infestation averted, and I'm pretty much happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: These little sticky stakes work perfectly-- fungus gnats get trapped, and I've never seen one get loose. The only downsides to them are that they're physically small, so I need to replace them more often than I'd like, and the adhesive is so sticky that it's gotten stuck to my hand a number of times. But both of those things are small prices to pay. These work far better than larger gnat traps or paper, simply because you can place them in the pot itself.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: My plants didn't need this
customer_reviews.text: Using these traps was both weirdly satisfying but ultimately not necessary. I recently replanted all of my new plants with fresh dirt and added some decorating stones and moss to each plant surface. I wanted to know if any insects were lurking anywhere on my plants or in the soil but I'm happy to report that I haven't caught anything unlike others in these reviews. I did see a tiny flying insect enter my apartment which wound up on a sticky tape so it works! I think I'll keep just a few traps in use just in case they catch anything else flying in the air like mosquitoes. Good to use as a diagnostic tool, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Free bird

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL BUT A BIG CONTRIBUTOR TO WASTE
customer_reviews.text: This product and work well and I continue order it under protest because I can't seem to find refills of the sticky paper. The only reason it isn't getting 5 stars from is because it appears that you can't just buy sticky paper as a refill. I have so many of the plastic stakes and hate that the only option is to throw them in the trash and contribute to the growing issue of too much waste and how it effects our ecosystem.
customer_reviews.author: Koala

customer_reviews.title: Actually working great!
customer_reviews.text: I was reading all the reviews and nervous... but just stake them in all your plants around your house and wait and leave them there as long as you can and you will be appalled at how many gnats you catch! We replaced them all once and now I don't have an issue. I also reduced frequency of watering and try not to have damp top soil. You can also add sand or diatomaceous earth to top layer to prevent them from laying eggs (google fungus gnats in house plants). These are a non-toxic way to physically rid your house of these pests!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Not effective for large infestations
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product, as it came highly recommended by some gardening sites, but unfortunately it did not live up to my expectations. The adhesive strips are incredibly small, and they send you more stakes than strips. This is a waste of plastic. If you have a medium to large infestation, these strips will not cut it. I recommend these instead  They are large, adhesive on both sides, more cost-effective, and more environmentally friendly. You can use them for longer because of their size.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: They worked fantastic for the first few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Used them at work when we suddenly had a zillion little flies. They worked fantastic for the first few weeks. Think you have to replace them to get the next hatching batch, the strength seems to have gone out of them. They're still sticky, they just don't seem to attract them....
customer_reviews.author: Starlight

customer_reviews.title: Basically just tape but it works
customer_reviews.text: My indoor plants developed fungus gnats. My mission became to hunt and kill them all. After a dose of peroxide water I still had gnats a few days later. I bought these guys ....and dang do they work. I stuck two to three to a pot. The bottom of the sticky traps are so covered there is barely any yellow showing. I threw the yellow sticky piece away and then just used regular packing tape and it worked the same.
customer_reviews.author: SarahMonroe

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had some knats all over my house plans and couldn’t get rid of them. I was spraying bug spray but that was going to end up ruining my plants. After researching I decided to purchase these. What appealed to me was the cute design. It mad it more attractive then just sticking a full sheet up. It not only looked more appleaing but I was amazed at how many knats the traps caught in just 2 day. I don’t even see any flying around my house plants any longer. Of course the yellow strips are a bit sticky so be careful putting them on. Other then that I totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Sticky paper not the solution.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my office plant, small ten inch collection of sedum plants. Weird generation of fungus flies in egg form were in the pot apparently. I put a stake up with the super sticky paper as seen in the instructions to see if I could remedy this situation. The first day it catch one fly after being up for 6 hours, that was all, so I still have that flies siblings buzzing around. It has been about a week now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_junky

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: I used these to control the tiny gnats that were around my houseplants through the winter. PROS: These are VERY sticky and attract the gnats. They kept the gnats in control and I no longer found them in other parts of the house. CON: They are bright yellow and are hard to conceal. I definitely will buy them again, though as they are the best solution I have found to date.
customer_reviews.author: Keyboard Player

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Plants!
customer_reviews.text: I had recieved some Peace Lillies when my grandfather passed. By the time I realized they had gnats, the gnats had spread to all of my plants in the house. I tried plant sprays and putting in a layer of sand, but they kept multiplying. Out of desperation, I tried this product and low and behold I started seeing less and less gnats. It does take about a month for them to fully go away because of the incubation time of the eggs. I will always have these on hand for new plants I bring into the house!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Insanely sticky
customer_reviews.text: These work. They’re annoying for a number of reasons: there’s no way to set them up without touching the sticky stuff, and it sticks on your fingers for a long time; sometimes the plant sticks to them; they’re really gross when they have a bunch of bugs sticking to them. But those are also all the reasons that they work. My friend was so excited to see all the gnats stuck to one of them that she made me send her the link so she can order her own. I do think they are a little overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Kadels

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but inadequate if you are fighting flying insects from large houseplants
customer_reviews.text: If you only have the occasional gnat of mosquito inside these are fine. However, if you are fighting flying insects from indoor plants such as fungus gnats its not gonna stop them since it only catches those that have already hatch. Recommend you combine these with a soil/root soak. Mix Hydrogen peroxide with normal water 4 parts water to 1 part peroxide and water the plants. It won't hurt the plant and it'll kill them in the soil before they emerge. You will need to repeat this about every week and 1/2, especially in really large plants, since the eggs will continue to hatch until all of the adults and larvae are killed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These WORK!
customer_reviews.text: My husband acts like Gnat is a “Bee” or a “Snake”. he flips out when he see’s one.. I did research, tried the Apple Cider and sugar and dish soap,, I caught may be 10.. I have a sunroom full of Herbs, and flowers.. So, I was determined to find a Solution! And I did, These! I could not believe how great they worked.. My dog brushed against one of them as she was “sun bathing”.. I had to pull it off, which hair came off too. So, I know a gnat can’t get away.. maybe husband was right, I had more than I knew.. all the black you see are gnats..
customer_reviews.author: Cheri D. Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had a tiny plant-gnat problem that wrecked all my plants the prior year; I tried so many products, none worked. When it happened again, new year, new plants, same gnats, I tried this as a final measure before my plants died. It took a few weeks, with fewer and fewer gnats trapped each week as their population declined, but eventually I was pest free with happy plants. I couldn't believe that such a simple product worked so well, but it did.
customer_reviews.author: Snark Twain

customer_reviews.title: The sticky paper will leave a film on your fingers that doesn't easily wash off but if you rub your fingers together ...
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. I had a huge gnat infestation and these took care of basically all of them. After only a few days of using them I don't see a single gnat. I have dozens and dozens of house plants, so I bought two packs and stuck a stake in several plants throughout my home, and in some random places, and it took care of them all! The sticky paper will leave a film on your fingers that doesn't easily wash off but if you rub your fingers together for a minute or so, the glue flakes off.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I knew we had gnats. It is either due to the time of year or soil we purchased that could have had them. We have tried everything to get rid of them. These little traps have captured a ton of bugs. It’s kind of unsettling to know we had so many. Problem solved. I would change them out as soon as they are half covered. And they look like an accessory to your plants.
customer_reviews.author: Bargnshppr

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Worst thing I have ever bought.. green stick made to look like a stem and yellow sticky papers.. pain in butt to put together and besides dubious claims. Of color being the attraction to bugs there is nothing to attract them..
customer_reviews.author: sllyrdhd1

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Product came quickly and it works as described. We have about 80 houseplants in our home. No matter where you buy houseplants, there are usually gnat eggs somewhere in the soil. As they hatch, there are soon gnats flying around the house plants. They are attracted to these sticky stakes and it eliminates them quickly, and with no fuss. We've used them for years.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt

customer_reviews.title: Sticky Stakes Work!
customer_reviews.text: We had an infestation of fugus gnats in our house plants. First, we used hydrogen peroxide and water 4:1 ratio to initially kill the larva, but still had the cycle of fugus gnats to contend with. The sticky stakes worked! We changed the sticky stakes twice on each plant and voila! you are able to see the dead gnats on the sticky stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. H

customer_reviews.title: EFFECTIVE!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and will be purchasing more. I got the three pack initially. I repotted several plants and developed an infestation of gnats. These strips really work and you can see all the bugs it captures. The strips stay sticky as well and I think they will stay that way until they are covered with bugs or dust.
customer_reviews.author: ACE

customer_reviews.title: Gnat problem solved!
customer_reviews.text: I have an indoor plant room where I keep succulents and other plants alive over winter. The gnats have been insanely thick this year. Even though the plant room is in the basement, the gnats still show up all over the house. Put these things in and haven’t seen a single gnat around the house since. The orange tags are covered with them in the plant room. Gross but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: LOTR417

customer_reviews.title: Great for gnats
customer_reviews.text: Used these on several plants for soil gnats and they worked great, I do wish more came in a package but they did the trick. They dont entirely eliminate the gnats from the soil but they do drastically help while you also treat the soil. I was amazed at how many had actually been flying around my house..yuck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: REALLY WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Every spring, we get invaded by tiny little fruit fly-sized bugs. They seem to live in the dirt of my houseplants, and smelly fruitfly traps would only catch one or two. These things, though.... they REALLY work. It's both disgusting and satisfying how quickly the yellow tabs get coated with tiny annoying victims. These curb the yearly invasion, and I keep one or two in pot the rest of the year to catch the stragglers. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: guppyfish

customer_reviews.title: Attracts Gnats from House Plants
customer_reviews.text: This is a stupid-simple product that kills gnats without chemicals. Basically strips of super sticky yellow tape. The color yellow attracts inserts like gnats from indoor houseplants that get stuck on the tape and then die. I’ve been seeing lots of these little buggers around, so I put a stake in each one of my plants and, within a couple of days, most of them had trapped several gnats. 👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: The Southern Review

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR FRUIT FLIES!
customer_reviews.text: They are advertised to work for “fruit flies” but they do not actually catch any fruit flies (Drosophila melanogaster) after more than a week. I placed these traps under a bar sink along with several little bowl/cup type of traps with liquid bait (beapco brand) and also clear sticky Catchmaster brand traps. The liquid beapco traps vastly outperformed these sticky stakes and the clear sticky traps. I’m summary, the best traps for fruit flies that I have tested are the liquid variety, like Beapco brand, and these sticky stakes get only 2 stars because they did not work AT ALL on fruit flies, for which they are advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Junkyard Brewing Co.

customer_reviews.title: Catches Bugs
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I’ve found that kills them. I don’t know why they’ve invaded my house plants, and I didn’t realize how many there were after setting up these stakes. The stakes were up about a week when I took the photo, the back is covered with bugs too. I just replaced it so I can catch more. Hopefully I can get rid of them for good.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Hot yellow strips!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer these adhesive strips to pesticide on my house plants, and they clean up the gnats fast. But I have to say that looking at those brite yellow strips covered with gnats is pretty off-putting! Could they use another color, or are the bugs attracted to yellow.?
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Results!  Warning Pictures Include Graphic Content!
customer_reviews.text: Put simply - these work! Moved to a new office in same building. It was immediately apparent there was a gnat issue. Purchased this product and placed it in several locations. Within 24 hours the yellow tape was loaded...I've replaced with new tape several times with the same immediate results. Hopefully, the gnats will be gone before I run out of strips! Will definitely repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nucker - Sarasota

customer_reviews.title: Effective!
customer_reviews.text: I’m trying to rid my avocado of these tiny flying insect. These photos were taken 3 days after putting them in. Seems to be helping! Also, to the people who say the strips are hard to install without getting fingers sticky. I disagree. Just fold the edges of white paper up, install onto stick, then peel off white paper. Simple. Within about 15 minutes I saw a couple of them already stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with product performance!
customer_reviews.text: This product is very easy to use and highly effective in eliminating the insects that were the problem in my houseplants. I did a side-by-side comparison with another similarly-highly-rated product (average if 4.5 stars although with many fewer reviewers). This brand won that competition hands-down, and I will use it again! I just wish I could buy in larger quantity than 7 in a package, and/or could get more of the sticky tape separately since the stakes can be re-used but the sticky-tape needs to be replaced frequently.
customer_reviews.author: SLH

customer_reviews.title: They work beter than the competition. If they are fresh
customer_reviews.text: I bought these twice they work better than the sheets you can buy because they are very sticky and most gnats cannot escape. The first package I purchased the backing came off easy and they worked great but the second one I purchased the backing would not come off. I believe they got to hot in shipping, as only one half or the backing was removable.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh R. Conquest

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Mold Gnats!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I didn't know how bad ALL my plants were affected until I put this in every plant. I've had the mold gnat problem for a couple of years now and couldn't figure out why I wasn't wiping them out with just the Neem Oil. If you have this problem, get these!
customer_reviews.author: NY Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I have the worst luck with house plant flies. I hate them so much! I’ve tried everything. These traps work very well. I put 1 in every plant and several in problem plants. I change them out every 2 weeks— completely covered in dead flies. I also use this with Diatomaceous earth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for potted plants
customer_reviews.text: Houseplant Sticky Stakes Insect Traps works perfect for my potted plants. Not only it catches a lot of adult gnats, it looks attractive and decorative beside the plants. I use this in conjunction to Systemic House Plant Insect Control, 0.22% Imidacloprid Insecticide
customer_reviews.author: navysblue

customer_reviews.title: Awful mistake
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think this through - I used them outside and killed every kind of flying insect you can imagine. I was trying to control a thrips infestation. Indoors, they're probably great for spider mites, gnats and fruitflies, but I can't recommend them for outside.
customer_reviews.author: treepee

customer_reviews.title: Does an AMAZING Job!
customer_reviews.text: So I garden all year long because I grow tropical plants indoors. Gnats are always a problem because of the organic materials and fresh composting. These sticky tapes have really helped reduce the little flying critters by huge amounts. I am lucky if I see one critter a day!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia M Berkbigler

customer_reviews.title: This is a great way to figure out which plant is infested
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 packs and put stakes in all of my plants. It helped me to identify which plants had the fruit flies / gnats and put them outside. My house is now insect free. I would highly recommend these. Much cleaner and easier than the homemade sugar traps.
customer_reviews.author: pocketheather

customer_reviews.title: Helps control in-home soil gnats.  Ordered 3 times
customer_reviews.text: These are really sticky. There's no chance of these little pests escaping once they've made contact with these. My only problem is the clips on the stakes don't hold the traps securely enough, hence the for star rating. All I have to do is brush by them and they release and adhere to my hand, sleeve, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Harry the Traveler

customer_reviews.title: The plants are much happier
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE DEFEATED SO MANY GNATS These are incredibly sticky, so watch out for your more delicate plants (and DON'T DROP THE STICKY STRIPS!!!) There are far fewer traps than stakes, but they ARE efficient. The gnats lost half their population within two days of putting these to work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I was having a problem with fungus gnats in my house plants and decided to try these as they were highly recommended for this type of bug. However, after leaving them in the pots for months the only thing on one of them was a fly. I found a recipe online for a solution of water and hydrogen peroxide that did the trick. So for me these were a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Shengulette

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! I have tried different methods to kill the little flys from my indoor plants. The strips can really glue the flys to the sticky surface. Of course, this is the way to reduce the number of flys but they will never disappear!! I also keep the top of soil dry and spray with other stuff on the surface!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: Works but misleading contents
customer_reviews.text: They work, but they were way overpriced. When I opened the box, I was surprised to find that a "trap" is one stake with one folded yellow sticky sheet. If you want to make a "tree" 3 stakes, tall, you only get to do that twice from a single box.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Moore

customer_reviews.title: Catches unwanted insects fast.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have ordered these. They really do work great. The only problem is they stick to everything that they come in contact with. No insect stands a chance with Safer Sticky Stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Boyd

customer_reviews.title: No chemical smell - no mess
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad to finally have the gnats OUT of my house. I like to keep my windows open during the year and the gnats flock to my three indoor plants. They settle in the dirt and then multiply. Now they get attracted to the yellow sticky and are completely gone from inside the house. I have told friends about how well this works. Great product and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Works as indicated for the most part ?
customer_reviews.text: Works well so far, still have a gnat or 2 flying around but does target the main culprit plants, I also use a botanic spray for gnats also, may have to move the targeted plants to the enclosed patio ? Gnats don’t seem to stick to traps while I am on the computer ?
customer_reviews.author: Beyous

customer_reviews.title: Does the job safely without chemicals
customer_reviews.text: I have over 70 plants and they got infested with fungus gnats. I tried a few methods unsuccessfully. I put these out the night before and the next day about 90% of the bugs we're gone. I did put out about 20 sticks with 2 sticky papers on each stick. I bought extra paper so each stick could have 2. You do need to combine this with some type of soil treatment in order to eliminate the eggs, the sticky paper only takes care of the adults.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! I’ve had a problem with small flies breeding in my indoor plants, nothing seemed to work. I tried vinegar, drying out the soil, changing the soil. I put these guys in there and I’ve seen a reduction of them around my house, and they are covered with the flies now. And the best part is they don’t look bad inside the plant pots either.
customer_reviews.author: Des and Jess

customer_reviews.title: STICKY STRIPS ARE JUST STICKY
customer_reviews.text: THEY SURE ARE STICKY. A LOT OF GNATS ON THEM, BUT I STILL HAVE GNATS. I HAVE EVEN USED SPRAY WITH THE STICKY STRIPS. I WISH IT HAD SOME KIND OF SCENT TO DRAW THE GNATS OUT OF THE DIRT.
customer_reviews.author: Zelda Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a product that attracts and kills them
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried EVERYTHING to kill these darn fungus gnats in my birds of paradise plant and NOTHING worked. Put these little suckers in and BOOM already caught a dozen within an hour! Just purchased some more. Very pleased with the product
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: These work great, but don't wear gloves when setting them up. SUPER sticky and got stuck, I ended up taking off my gloves and just dealing with it on my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: We had soil gnats. These are easy to use, and you can visibly see that they trap the gnats. It didn’t eliminate the problem entirely, but greatly reduced the number.
customer_reviews.author: cfs

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is WOW! Put in my house plants I was shocked how many knats came out of my house plants. They're gone now thanks to these sticky strips!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great for ridding plant of fungus gnats!
customer_reviews.text: I repotted an orchid & in spite of soaking the soil in boiling hot water, fungus gnats soon appeared. These traps worked perfectly. I cut the sticky traps into smaller pieces about 3/4" x 3/4 " square and lay a few of them them on top of the soil. I haven't seen the pesty gnats in about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Zacharia

customer_reviews.title: More useful as an indicator.
customer_reviews.text: I used these on an indoor plant that was infected with gnats. The sticky strips were easy to use and certainly trapped a lot of gnats, but I found that I needed to add a chemical gnat control to the soil to solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: A. W.

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: You have more gnats in your house than you would think. Eww and useful simultaneously I wish there were more strips to replace the ones that got filled. But it’s still good
customer_reviews.author: SusyErnie

customer_reviews.title: they get it done
customer_reviews.text: They do the job right, but there are so few stickies in comparison to stakes, I ran out too quickly. I won't buy again as they don't attract as many gnats, but are still useful.
customer_reviews.author: Season

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: Love them, they catch the nats that attach to indoor plants and get into food cabinets. They look good on the plants. Very cleaver.
customer_reviews.author: Helen P. Oldershaw

customer_reviews.title: Took awhile for this to work.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipment. Packed very well. Great seller. Product is soso. I have lots of plant gnats, and after using these two week, I just started to see the gnats on the stick paper; however, there are lots more gnats to go.
customer_reviews.author: Nanette Evans

customer_reviews.title: Love the small scale and customization options for houseplants
customer_reviews.text: These little sticky traps worked well with my fungus gnat infestation! I really liked how small the posts were and the options you have to use more or less stickies. I also hadn't realized that there were 7 sticks to a pack, so I have a stockpile of little yellow sticky traps now.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: So-so Product
customer_reviews.text: These sticky stakes do collect gnats but do not stop them from propagating. After many get stuck to the tape, more keep continuing to appear. I think they are coming from the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Wild West K

customer_reviews.title: My Dad is OBSESSED with these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought them as a Christmas stocking-stuffer for him and he now uses them in all of his plants. I wish I had a picture to show y'all! They catch so many flies. I highly recommend these to anyone who keeps orchids or other house plants.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonders on Plants!
customer_reviews.text: I buy these to go in the dirt of my plants because they tend to have gnats. These work wonderfully and keeps the gnats away.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: One of my newer houseplants apparently came with a side order of gnats, who very quickly made themselves at home. I tried various remedies; vinegar and soap, sand over potting soil, etc., but nothing really worked. These little sticky stakes took care of the problem in two days time. I couldn't be more pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Holohan

customer_reviews.title: These really work!!
customer_reviews.text: Before using these I had no idea how bad the bug infestation was in my indoor plants. Yikes! The strips are easy to use and started working within a day or two. Huge result within a week. SO much easier than using a spray.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Ever since we had a bathroom remodeled and construction crews kept leaving doors open (in AZ, in July!), we've had a mosquito problem INDOORS! These are easy enough to put together but in 2 weeks, they've caught exactly zero mosquitoes! They seem to be nothing more than sticky heavy paper. No insecticide that I can smell. I'm having better luck with Raid.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Just sticky tape that is hard to put on the clips. Nothing attracts the bugs at all. If one happens to land on the tiny sticky strip, it might get stuck but mostly the flying fruit flies just flew away. Small surface area anyway. Find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sticky
customer_reviews.text: I caught a lot of fungus gnat adults with these traps. They are very sticky and easily stick to a sleeve or hand/finger rather than staying in the pot. They also will stick to your dog or cat's fur, so make sure your pet can't get near them.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: It works really well
customer_reviews.text: I set them up. The first day, trapped one or two gnats. After the second day, one of the yellow strips was covered in dead gnats. Yeah this product works.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro B.

customer_reviews.title: Kills tiny bugs
customer_reviews.text: It traps the little gnats around my potted plants that have damp, moist soil. Serves its purpose well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Thao

customer_reviews.title: Seemingly Useless
customer_reviews.text: I have a few gnats around the plants, these insect traps seem to be ineffective. I've used them for a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Get Rid of Nasty Gnats!
customer_reviews.text: These worked great! By putting them in several plants I located which plant has the gnat problem and have trapped/killed hundreds! Got rid of my gnat problem. I would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Belinda J. King

customer_reviews.title: Southern gnat catchers
customer_reviews.text: So I live in the south. We collect bugs everywhere. And so far these really do pretty great. I used to have ones on the windows but these are a lot less conspicuous.
customer_reviews.author: Zakary

customer_reviews.title: Easy, chemical free way to get rid of little bugs in my plants
customer_reviews.text: These were just what I needed to get rid of the little nasty bugs that came in when I brought my plants inside after summer. I have a family and a dog in my house so I don’t want to use pesticides or excess chemicals around the house. I just wish I took a pic before I changed a couple of them about 2 weeks ago. They were just covered in these little gnats!
customer_reviews.author: Molly S

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this to help with The tiny flies that live ...
customer_reviews.text: Within a few minutes a few flies were already stuck to the pads. A couple days later and a few of the sticky pads are almost covered. I wish this product came with more pads for the stakes though. Even so, I recommend this to help with The tiny flies that live in potted plants
customer_reviews.author: geoleila

customer_reviews.title: These really worked!
customer_reviews.text: These were covered in gnats and a few flies! After these ran out I tried the box of 100 from a different brand and gnats landed and flew away. “Safer” brand works perfect! I’m ordering more of these.
customer_reviews.author: R.K.

customer_reviews.title: these work!!
customer_reviews.text: If you love plants and hate the little blacks flies that appear from no where get these they WORK!!
customer_reviews.author: Anne M. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Fungus gnats are no more
customer_reviews.text: These are super sticky and worked great with my houseplants to reduce my minor fungus gnat problem.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, just poor delivery system
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, not satisfied with these sticky stakes. the individual strips would slip off the stick carrier, landing on leaves and would stick on them, what a mess!
customer_reviews.author: hummingbird

customer_reviews.title: Put in plants and grabs those bugs - Works great
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. Traps small nats in houseplants very well. Easy to setup and throw away. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Edweirdo

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should and trapped many gnats and fruit ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should and trapped many gnats and fruit flies during my use. I haven't had crops with gnats and fruit flies lately but when I do I will for sure give this brand another buy!
customer_reviews.author: CH2iS*

customer_reviews.title: Works fabulously, See for yourself!!
customer_reviews.text: Great gnat control for my plants. After this eradicates most of the adults, I will be putting sand on top of the top soil to get rid of the others and obviously less watering to control it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great for gnats in houseplants
customer_reviews.text: These things catch a whole lot of fungus gnats. I do wish they were significantly cheaper, though. I'm gonna need to go through a lot of them before my plants are pest-free.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Works Quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order. I ordered this last summer and there was enough to last the entire season. This gets rid of gnats quickly. Gnats come around our kitchen window and they are quickly caught on the tape. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: J.P

customer_reviews.title: A good idea but...
customer_reviews.text: ...I probably won't purchase again. The sticky part really doesn't stay put. Could be the humidity in FL and they might work better in other climates.
customer_reviews.author: Gardenbun

customer_reviews.title: Simple effective product
customer_reviews.text: This definitely works for getting rid of fungus gnats. Would highly recommend. I only wish I could have gotten it in the store verses online. Worth the money which is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Book Fan

customer_reviews.title: It didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t work. It caught one and has not caught anymore but they are still flying around
customer_reviews.author: Judie

customer_reviews.title: Dont let it bug you
customer_reviews.text: Works great even better if you combine this with diatomaceous earth food grade.
customer_reviews.author: olliy

customer_reviews.title: Work good but not a value.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this a 5 star review because they work great, however there are way too many stakes and not enough sticky strips for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo Y.

customer_reviews.title: Work Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleased to discover these actually work! It took about a week, but my gnat problem is gone! The only strange thing about this product is that it comes with more sticks than sticky paper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instant bug collector!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Bugs are instantly attracted, I couldn’t believe how many bugs were in my plant! Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Z

customer_reviews.title: It works. am taking the stake to my Garden ...
customer_reviews.text: It works. am taking the stake to my Garden center to find out what I need to get to get rid of the pests.
customer_reviews.author: G ma

customer_reviews.title: Great for Office Spaces with Plants
customer_reviews.text: My co-worker said the gnats weren't coming from the plants. Well, there were families of gnats living in the dirt. We purchased 3 packs and they decreased the infestation by about 90%. These work great!
customer_reviews.author: Abram Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Gnats love these!
customer_reviews.text: Gnats love flying on to these. I wish they were cheaper, but they work effectively.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Work Well
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. I place them in my herb pots and my orchid pots and they keep all the little fruit flies that pop up from flying around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent & highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Must have for indoor plants! I got so annoyed at gnats flying in my face & landing in my food/drink. Got a bunch of these to see if it works or not. I’m both amazed & disgusted at how many gnats are caught on these things. Ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: DIY handy lady

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, previous reviews were good. Keeping an eye out for fungus flies that have been an issue with an indoor plant. I used 2 sticks and 4 traps.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Finley-Urbania

product_meta.title: HOME-OUTDOOR Safer Brand 5025 Houseplant Sticky Stakes Insect Trap, (14 Traps)
product_meta.description: Size:2 Pack (14 Traps)An insect infestation that has targeted your houseplants can be a sticky situation. Whiteflies, black-flies and midges are just a few of the many insects that can inflict plenty of damage on your plants in a short period of time. Safer Brand Houseplant Sticky Stakes can provide an effective, organic alternative to synthetic pesticides. Safer Brand Houseplant Sticky Stakes are ideal for use indoors or outdoors in potted plants. These sticky stakes for houseplants are an economical and convenient solution to the annoyances of whiteflies, fungus gnats, black-flies, thrips, fruit flies, midges and other flying insects. These houseplant sticky stakes contain no pesticides and are fully disposable. The yellow color of the trap as well as the glue will attract the insects. Shake the plant gently and insects hidden on the leaves will fly to the traps.
feature_bullets: Attracts and traps white flies, fungus gnats, black-flies, thrips, fruit flies, midges and other flying insects
Fully disposable - A natural pest control - contains no pesticides

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars564 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
